intro: Selinum bulbocastanum, commonly known as the bulbous starwort, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its bulbous roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Selinum bulbocastanum thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges.
